title: Private Yacht Luxury: Sydney Group Charter for up to Eight Guests with All-Inclusive Drinks, Dining & Post-Cruise Stay
description:
Step away from the mainland and witness the glittering wonders of Sydney’s glamorous harbour from a different perspective: onboard the spectacular, 98-foot Sunseeker CHAOS yacht. Gather your friends and family (up to eight guests) and set sail for a once-in-a-lifetime experience soaking in the gorgeous views, sipping on unlimited premium drinks and enjoying all-inclusive, chef-prepared dining. Enjoy private transfers from Sydney's CBD to reach your floating hotel, then relax in comfort as your yacht is expertly navigated across the waters.

Onboard, you will find four exquisite cabins, each with its own ensuite, along with generous dining spaces, a stylish lounge area, an onboard entertainment system with a TV and streaming services, a fully equipped kitchen, and a spacious sundeck with a swimming platform for easy ocean access. Throughout, you'll be in the capable hands of a dedicated Guest Experience Manager, who will curate your journey every step of the way to ensure it exceeds your expectations. Outstanding service is the hallmark of the crew who'll be available 24 hours a day, including a dedicated executive chef. After your stay onboard this superb vessel, you’ll enjoy two nights of post-cruise accommodation in a deluxe Palm Beach residence - a tranquil, central boutique retreat boasting four king bedrooms, modern amenities, beach access and incredible views of Illuka Beach.
offer_address: Sydney NSW 2020

title: Five-Star Pier One Sydney Harbour Escape with Daily Breakfast & Welcome Cocktails
description:
Experience Sydney’s buzzing cosmopolitan vibe from one of its most iconic hotels, the five-star Pier One Sydney Harbour - part of Marriott's premium Autograph Collection. This heritage property is a significant part of both the city’s maritime history and the instantly recognisable skyline, thanks to its Sydney Harbour Bridge location.

The winner of a Tripadvisor Travellers’ Choice 2021 award, Pier One Sydney enchants its guests with a stylish, contemporary design, exceptional service and luxurious facilities. Savour premium waterside dining incorporating sustainable NSW produce, and toast your escape with a handcrafted cocktail at the sleek harbourfront Bar One. There’s no location more enviable than Pier One Sydney Harbour, with its unobscured views of Walsh Bay’s sparkling waters and Sydney Harbour Bridge. Plus, the city’s most famous sites are all within easy reach: the historic The Rocks district, Sydney Opera House and Royal Botanic Garden Sydney are all within a breezy 20-minute walk.

offer_address: Walsh Bay, 11 Hickson Rd, Sydney NSW 2000

title: The Langham, Sydney Luxury Buffet Experience for Two at Kitchens on Kent with Glass of Premium Sparkling Wine
description:
Savour a decadent buffet experience at Kitchens on Kent, where local produce and culinary expertise lead the way to unforgettable dining. Located at the five-star The Langham, Syndey hotel, Kitchens on Kent redefines the concept of a buffet with interactive cooking stations that allow you to engage with a host of talented chefs. Choose as many dishes as you like and watch as your meal is prepared right in front of you. Each international kitchen serves up delicious flavours under the guidance of an expert, who will prepare your chosen dish to your specific taste. During your dining experience, you can ask for the chef's invaluable advice or simply watch in awe as your meal comes together.

During this two-hour experience, dine on some of the most delectable dishes you can find in Sydney from a range of international cuisines, including a New York-style grill, a wok station and dim sum corner, an Indian tandoor kitchen and more. Expect a selection of all-you-can-eat gourmet seafood, including sushi, salmon, kingfish, tiger prawns, Moreton Bay bugs and local Sydney rock oysters with mignonette dressing. A mouth-watering pasta kitchen and healthy salad bar, along with a large selection of sweet treats (including a chocolate fountain) will round out your culinary adventure. With a glass of premium sparkling wine included, this lavish feast combined with the luxe environment and friendly, attentive staff, will surely leave you satisfied.

title: Sydney nel. Restaurant: The Great British Menu 11-Course Degustation Experience for Two with Prosecco on Arrival
description:
Expand your culinary horizons with a multi-course dining experience like no other at nel., winner of 14 AGFG Chef Hats and one of Sydney's most distinctive fine-dining restaurants. nel. has quickly established itself as one of the most exciting and innovative restaurants in Australia. Spearheading the kitchen, Executive Chef and owner Nelly Robinson and his team are widely celebrated for the unique dining experience they've crafted. Nelly’s robust understanding and appreciation of the best produce is showcased in every dish and is guaranteed to throw guests into a food frenzy.

A getaway to the UK is brought to you with this newly themed degustation, 'The Great British Menu'. It's a theme that's very near and dear to English chef Nelly's heart, and a nod to the head chef and restaurant manager, who are also Brits. The entire menu has been built and inspired by their memories of home, bringing a taste of the UK to their guests. You can expect a fun twist on dishes such as roast lamb, classic bangers and mash, and even British biscuit favourite, Jaffa Cakes.

Nestled in Sydney's beautiful Surry Hills, and freshly refurbished in a bunker-esque environment, nel. offers a relaxed, intimate and entertaining atmosphere. There are no white tablecloths here, just top-notch service and a wine list to match. It’s a degustation sure to surprise and delight, so don't miss out on this magical evening, complete with a glass of prosecco each on arrival.

description:
Prepare to be spellbound by the most incredible event of the year - enter a world of splendour and romance, of eye-popping excess, glitz, grandeur and glory. Pop the champagne and prepare for the spectacular...welcome to **Moulin Rouge! The Musical.** Winner of 10 Tony Awards®, Baz Luhrmann's revolutionary film comes to life onstage, remixed in a new musical mash-up extravaganza featuring over 70 songs, including many of the iconic hits from the movie, as well as additions from Adele, Katy Perry, Sia, Beyonce, Rihanna and more. **Moulin Rouge! The Musical** is a theatrical celebration of truth, beauty, freedom and - above all - love.

Feel every emotion and hear every note of this critically acclaimed musical, while discovering the glitz and glamour of Sydney with a stay at Rydges World Square. title: Barangaroo Sydney: CHI by Lotus Eight-Course Tasting Menu for Two Guests with Signature Cocktail
description:
Inspired by the vibrant night markets found on Beijing’s Ghost Street, CHI has been designed to bring to life the buzzing atmosphere of the popular Chinese food street. Much of CHI’s menu is bar-style food made to share with strong use of shaokao (Chinese-style barbeque) and features handmade dumplings, synonymous with the Lotus brand. You'll try its Sichuan-style spicy pork and prawn wontons, Sydney rock oysters, its infamous Wagyu skewers, and many more dishes. CHI also takes its bar offering seriously and serves up an extensive drinks list including innovative Chinese inspired cocktails like its signature Chi Spritz, which you will be greeted with on arrival.

The stylish space has been designed by award-winning architecture and interior design firm, Luchetti Krelle, and channels the famous night markets with its sea of red and white lanterns, tassels and a palette of warm golden tones; authentic yet sophisticated. Rows and rows of lucky Maneki-Neko cats wave hello from above the open kitchen while two large golden skylights cast a warm glow across the dining area, with upbeat music creating a fun and lively ambience.

After opening in 2015, nel. has quickly established itself as one of the most exciting and innovative restaurants in Australia. Executive Chef and owner Nelly Robinson and his team are widely celebrated for the unique dining experience they have crafted, with a rotation of degustation-only menus designed to showcase Robinson's appreciation of the best produce. His new 'Land & Sea' menu is a celebration of local New South Wales artisan produce, including beautiful seafood like swordfish and king prawns, and desserts with unlikely pairings such as honey and potato.

Nestled in Sydney's beautiful Surry Hills, in a freshly refurbished, intimate environment, nel. offers a relaxed and entertaining atmosphere. There are no white tablecloths here, just top-notch service and a wine list to match. It’s a degustation sure to surprise and delight, so don't miss out on this magical evening, complete with a glass of prosecco each on arrival.

From pasture to plate, from the fishermen to the table, Manta boasts a strong knowledge of their produce, thanks to the owner, Rob Rubis, who boasts 35 years of hospitality experience. If you are searching for passion that can be felt from the moment you walk in the door, this experience is sure to delight. Dripping in culinary expertise, the team at Manta provides an exquisite culinary experience you won’t soon forget. 

A fitting scene for memorable dining on the harbour, you’ll enjoy water and skyline views as you indulge in Australia’s finest produce and the best of local and international wines. Through a six-course tasting menu, you’ll savour a variety of dishes showcasing the best of the land and sea. Start with yellowfin tuna, scallop ceviche or a caviar tart before diving into a scallop and chorizo dish followed by Glacier 51 Toothfish paired with mixo and purple kale. Finish with fresh watermelon and a decadent white chocolate mousse. Plus, enjoy paired wines with each dish, which promise to take your culinary adventure to the next level.

title: Heritage Sydney Sanctuary near Darling Harbour with Onsite Spanish Wine Bar
description:
Step into the rich tapestry of Sydney's history with a stay at this heritage hotel, housed in a 19th-century wool store mere moments from Darling Harbour. Hotel Woolstore 1888, Sydney - Handwritten Collection's industrial chic aesthetic of exposed brick walls, recycled timber and vibrant street art pieces conjures a striking picture of the city's rich past.

Head downstairs and indulge in the intimate surroundings of the onsite PERCY - Pyrmont's Spanish-learning neighbourhood wine bar - or wander across the footbridge that connects Pyrmont to the Barangaroo precinct to explore the endless harbourside dining and entertainment options. If you wish to explore more, Sydney’s iconic locales, including Circular Quay and the Sydney Opera House, are all located just across shimmering waves.
offer_address: 139 Murray St, Sydney, New South Wales, 2009, Australia

title: Cosmopolitan Luxury in Sydney's Cultural Hub
description: Feel anchored by decades of excellence and signature comforts at PARKROYAL Darling Harbour, Sydney, stunningly intertwined with the Sydney skyline and boasting a central location. You'll be just minutes from major attractions and cultural landmarks including the Pitt Street Mall shopping precinct and the leafy gardens of Hyde Park. When hunger bites, return to your base and indulge in the chef's tasting menu or a glass of boutique wine at ABODE Bistro. Bar.
offer_address: 150 Day Street, Sydney 2000, New South Wales, Australia

title: Modern Sydney CBD Break with Onsite Brewery, Rooftop Pool & Sauna
description:
Delve into the heart of the city from this modern oasis, perfectly positioned within Sydney's bustling CBD. Just mere steps from Central Station, this contemporary abode is the ideal launchpad to explore the city's most iconic attractions, all in utmost comfort with all you could need at your fingertips.

Explore the eclectic food scene in nearby Chinatown, stroll through the lush Royal Botanic Gardens or catch a show at the iconic Sydney Opera House. After a day of exploration, retreat to the hotel's Platform 818 Restaurant & Bar for a sip and a bite, enjoy a refreshing drink at the Sydney Brewery, or relax your muscles with a dip in the heated rooftop pool overlooking the city skyline.
offer_address: 818-820 George Street, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia

title: Sydney Airport Boutique Stay with Cocktail Bar & Rooftop Cinema
description:
Refresh and recharge at Citadines Connect Sydney Airport, an ultra-luxe hotel located just a 10-minute stroll from Sydney Airport's Domestic T2 Terminal. Home to a collection of stylish rooms flaunting big cosy beds, invigorating showers and ample space to stretch your plane legs, this boutique hotel offers all you need for a great night's sleep. Stock up on tasty meals and snacks at Grab & Go, get moving in the retro-inspired Athletic Club or stay connected with family, friends and colleagues in the designated workspace. Roll up to the Penthouse and relax at the cocktail bar or heated terrace, then catch a flick at the rooftop cinema.

Got time to explore? Hop on the Skytrain at Sydney Airport and find yourself surrounded by the icons of Circular Quay in just 20 minutes.
offer_address: 121 Baxter Rd, Mascot NSW 2020

title: Sydney Hyatt Harbourside Elegance Overlooking the Opera House with Signature Dining & Rooftop Pool
description:
Perched on the edge of Sydney Harbour, Park Hyatt Sydney offers front-row seats to Australia's most iconic view. Wake to sunlight dancing across the Sydney Opera House, then step onto the private rooftop terrace to catch the harbour's morning ballet of ferries and sailboats. When you're ready to explore, Sydney Harbour Bridge and Darling Harbour are on your doorstep.

Dive into coastal Australian flavours at the two waterfront restaurants before cooling off with a dip in the rooftop pool - Sydney's most enviable swimming spot.  After a day of adventures, the spa awaits to knead away your worries with treatments inspired by Australia's ancient healing traditions.
offer_geo_area_level_2: Council of the City of Sydney
offer_address: 7 Hickson Road, The Rocks, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia

title: Contemporary Central Sydney CBD Escape with Onsite Brewery
description: There's central, and then there's Rydges Sydney Central, a stylish hotel just a stone’s throw from Sydney's main train station - offering connections to glittering Circular Quay, iconic Bondi and the Blue Mountains - and the best bits of the Harbour City. Perched in cosmopolitan Surry Hills, the bespoke hotel is surrounded by cafés serving specialty coffee and brilliant brunches, modern restaurants championing seasonal Aussie produce and every type of drinking den - from speakeasies to rooftops and everything in between. Though, you won’t have to go far for delicious fare: the hotel is home to Sydney Brewery, a craft brewery responsible for some of the city’s best beers. In the morning, pop down to the Manna Loft restaurant for breakfast and later, return for a few laps in the indoor pool or sweat it out in the gym or sauna.
offer_address: 28 Albion Street, Surry Hills, New South Wales 2010, Australia

vendor_name: Holiday Inn & Suites Sydney Bondi Junction
title: Sleek Sydney Escape Minutes from Bondi Beach
description: Discover a laidback side of Sydney with a beachy escape at Holiday Inn & Suites Sydney Bondi Junction, an IHG Hotel, nestled between lush Centennial Park and Bondi Beach. This end of the city is a shopper's paradise, an ocean-lover's dream and a foodie's heaven, with open-air markets, boutiques and streets bursting with cafes and decadent restaurants. Cherish the sunshine and the saltwater breeze as you explore one of Australia's most sought-after neighbourhoods.
location_description: Holiday Inn and Suites Sydney Bondi Junction, an IHG Hotel
offer_address: 28 Spring Street, Bondi Junction, New South Wales 2022, Australia

title: Contemporary Mantra Chatswood Stay next to Westfield Shopping Precinct
description:
Discover a stylish urban oasis perfectly positioned in Sydney's northeastern suburbs. Sitting directly opposite Westfield Chatswood, with over 250 stores including Myer, and Hoyts Cinemas, this hotel boasts easy access to Chatswood Transport Interchange while being just moments away from world-class boutiques and restaurants.

The hotel offers fabulous facilities, including a shimmering indoor heated pool, a modern onsite restaurant and a fully equipped fitness centre. For a well-deserved drink after hours of shopping up a storm, the terrace beckons with uninterrupted vistas that stretch far into the horizon.
offer_address: 10 Brown Street, Chatswood, New South Wales 2067, Australia

title: Sydney Five-Star Circular Quay Escape near Harbour Bridge
description:
Be part of Sydney's iconic cityscape with a stay at the five-star InterContinental Sydney, located among one of the city's most prized landmarks. The hotel is set within the beautifully restored Treasury Building of 1851, and sits in the heart of Circular Quay, Sydney's buzzing tourism precinct and just moments from the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. 

Discover an elevated experience at Aster, Sydney’s exclusive rooftop bar. Indulge in expansive harbour views, creative cocktails, artful small plates and highly-personalised service. Before setting out for a night on the town, stop in The Treasury Bar for a classic cocktail or indulge in a romantic dinner at Pont Dining Room. When it comes to leisure and culture, all bases are covered with an indoor heated swimming pool overlooking the Sydney Opera House, and a fine art gallery located on the ground floor.
offer_address: 117 Macquarie St, Sydney NSW 2000

title: Five-Star Sydney CBD Heritage Inspired Luxury
description:
Experience five-star luxury in the heart of Sydney’s CBD with an enriching stay at The Fullerton Hotel Sydney. Housed in a heritage-listed architectural masterpiece dating back to 1874, The Fullerton Hotel Sydney is within walking distance to the most sought-after central city attractions including the Sydney Opera House, Circular Quay, Royal Botanic Garden Sydney, Barangaroo and endless noteworthy restaurants. 

Inside, you’ll find the perfect fusion of heritage and modern elegance. Take a seat at The Place restaurant in the light-filled atrium and delight in modern Australian cuisine as well as Southeast Asian favourites and end the evening at The Bar where expertly crafted cocktails such as the Sydney Sling can be found. After a day of exploring the city, delve into the tales and stories of the heritage GPO Building past with the hotel’s complimentary 90-minute guided heritage tour or head to the onsite Endota Spa for an afternoon of relaxation - the perfect antidote to busy city days.
offer_address: 1 Martin Pl, Sydney NSW 2000

title: Iconic The Star Sydney Five-Star City Break with World-Class Entertainment and Dining
description: Sink into Sydney glamour with a five-star stay at The Star Grand Hotel, perfectly positioned in Pyrmont, the harbourside heart, where sweeping city views meet high-end dining and world-class entertainment. Take your tastebuds to new heights at one of The Star's award-winning restaurants - including mindblowing culinary odyssey Ele by Federico & Karl - catch a show at the Sydney Lyric Theatre, or head to G&Tea for ribbon sandwiches, high tea and one of the city's best gin and tonics.
offer_address: 80 Pyrmont Street, Pyrmont, New South Wales 2009, Australia

vendor_name: The William Inglis Hotel - MGallery by Sofitel
title: Contemporary Sydney Warwick Farm Luxury with Day Spa & Rooftop Pool
description:
Experience the charm of Sydney's South West with a stay at this luxurious hotel, perfectly positioned in the heart of Warwick Farm. Just moments from the world-renowned Warwick Farm Racecourse, this charming retreat offers a unique blend of equine history and modern comforts.

Explore the nearby attractions including the stunning Chipping Norton Lake and the bustling Liverpool City Centre. Return to the hotel to enjoy a refreshing dip in the outdoor pool before savouring the finest local produce at the onsite Newmarket Room restaurant, or enjoy a refreshing drink at the 1867 Lounge.
location_description: The William Inglis Hotel - MGallery Collection
offer_address: 155 Governor Macquarie Drive, Warwick Farm, New South Wales 2170, Australia

title: Coogee Beach Bliss Just 20 Minutes from Sydney CBD with Rooftop Swimming Pool
description: Take a few steps out of the door of Crowne Plaza Coogee Beach and you'll find yourself leaving footprints across Coogee Beach, one of Sydney's most beloved stretches of sand. Views of the pristine coastline are found at every turn in the hotel, whether from your private balcony or over breakfast at the effortlessly stylish Shutters restaurant. For fresh seafood and a cocktail before a rooftop pool swim, enjoy the relaxed ambience of Estate, which pays homage to America's west coast seaside bars.
location_description: Crowne Plaza Coogee Beach, an IHG Hotel
offer_address: 242 Arden St, Coogee NSW 2034, Australia

title: Boutique Sydney City Break Adjacent to Broadway Sydney Shopping Mall & Victoria Park
description:
Immerse yourself in the cosmopolitan charm of Sydney with a boutique stay in Glebe, near the heart of the city. This contemporary retreat is a stone's throw from nearby eclectic eateries and the cultural treasures of the Powerhouse Museum. Drive 15 minutes to Darling Harbour or Chinatown to explore the most iconic city sights.

Perhaps start the day with breakfast on the ground floor of your hotel, then shop till you drop at bustling Broadway Shopping Centre or take a leisurely stroll through Victoria Park, just next door. When you return, relax in your modern and chic accommodation, complete with all comforts needed for an easy city break.
offer_address: 253 Broadway, Glebe, New South Wales 2037, Australia

title: Sophisticated Hyde Park Hotel with Two Restaurants & Bars
description:
Overlooking Hyde Park, this sophisticated Pullman retreat is just moments from the city's renowned shopping precincts, Darling Harbour and the iconic Sydney Opera House. Work up an appetite with a swim at the rooftop pool, or sweat it out at the onsite fitness centre and sauna. When it's time to refuel, savour innovative cuisine at the hotel's onsite restaurant, Windows on the Park, with verdant garden views, or sip a refreshing drink at Bar Thirty6 alongside a tapas-inspired grazing menu. 

When its time to venture out, pay a visit to the Art Gallery of New South Wales or take a leisurely stroll to the nearby Royal Botanic Gardens. Plus, with the vibrant Surry Hills and the nightlife of Oxford Street nearby, you'll be spoilt for choice with places explore.
offer_address: 36 College Street, Darlinghurst, Sydney, New South Wales 2010, Australia

title: Castle Hill Sydney Studios & Apartments near Norwest Business Park
description:
Located in the heart of Sydney's Hills District, this retreat is perfectly positioned for both business and leisure travellers. This comfortable hotel is within easy reach of the vibrant Norwest Business Park and the shopping delights of Castle Towers. 

Foodies will love the nearby local eateries, while nature lovers can explore the serene beauty of the adjacent Bidjigal Reserve. The hotel also offers a state-of-the-art fitness centre, ensuring guests can maintain their wellness routine during their stay.
offer_address: 8 Gladstone Road, Castle Hill, Sydney, NSW 2154

title: Surry Hills Boutique Heritage Hotel with Rooftop Garden & Bespoke Art Collection
description: Discover boutique home-away-from-home comforts in Sydney's elegant Surry Hills. This meticulously restored heritage building is a stone's throw from the city's finest eateries, artisan bakeries and eclectic boutiques. Each room is a sanctuary of style, featuring curated artworks and bespoke furnishings. While here, help yourself to a tipple from the honour bar or ascend to the rooftop for panoramic views of the city skyline.
offer_address: 21 Little Albion St, Surry Hills, 2010 NSW, Australia
